The specified value has been assigned to a stack location.

Load or store it there, with appropriate extension if necessary.

### getStackAddress() {#a1ebcdacc79bcbbbb515e69090df3ea18}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Register anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;X86CallLowering.cpp&#125;::X86IncomingValueHandler::getStackAddress (uint64&#95;t MemSize, int64&#95;t Offset, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> &amp; MPO, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/isd/argflagsty">ISD::ArgFlagsTy</a> Flags)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Materialize a VReg containing the address of the specified stack-based object.

This is either based on a FrameIndex or direct SP manipulation, depending on the context. <code>MPO</code> should be initialized to an appropriate description of the address created.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/gisel/x86calllowering-cpp/#l00192">192</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/gisel/x86calllowering-cpp">X86CallLowering.cpp</a>.

How the physical register gets marked varies between formal parameters (it&#39;s a basic-block live-in), and a call instruction (it&#39;s an implicit-def of the BL).
